intro: Cordia tarodae, commonly known as the Tarodae's cordia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy, pink or white flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in dry, open habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
